channel.title: Energy & Environment
channel.description: News, Analysis and Opinion from POLITICO

item.title: Trump delayed a global carbon tax. Now he wants to finish the fight.
item.description: American officials are drafting a diplomatic cable that warns dozens of countries against adopting a climate fee on the shipping industry.

media:content.media:title: A container ship sails in front of the Manhattan skyline in New York in January.

item.dc:creator: By Sara Schonhardt

item.title: Federal safety regulator warns his office can’t keep up with Trump’s Alaska oil push
item.description: The warning shows how the administration’s earlier DOGE-driven cuts to the federal workforce could cause problems for Trump’s other policy objectives.

media:content.media:title: The Trump administration is set to hold the first oil and gas lease sale in more than three years in Alaska's Cook Inlet next week.

item.dc:creator: By James Bikales

item.title: Here’s a reality check on Trump’s AI pledge
item.description: Trump’s promise to protect power customers’ wallets from data centers covers only part of the costs of expanding AI.

media:content.media:title: A QTS data center is seen in Ashburn, Virginia, on Nov. 20, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Zack Colman and Peter Behr
item.dc:contributor: By Zack Colman and Peter Behr

item.title: Underdog Democrats lean into data center concerns
item.description: Democrats in particular have seized on the prospect of rising energy costs in the fight for control of Washington and state capitals.

media:content.media:title: Abdul El-Sayed, a Democratic candidate for Senate in Michigan, released a "Terms of Engagement" on data centers.

item.dc:creator: By Timothy Cama, Amelia Davidson and Natalie Fertig
item.dc:contributor: By Timothy Cama, Amelia Davidson and Natalie Fertig

item.title: Trump sidelines climate contrarians in science rollback
item.description: The president has mocked global warming as a “hoax,” but his administration avoided testing that claim in court as it targeted the endangerment finding.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump said Thursday that EPA has rolled back its authority to regulate greenhouse gases.

item.dc:creator: By Scott Waldman

item.title: Trump's big climate reversal sets up a courtroom clash
item.description: EPA has chucked the long-standing finding that greenhouse gas emissions drive climate change, drawing promises of lawsuits from environmentalists and Democrats.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump has undone the greenhouse gas endangerment finding, the foundation for EPA's biggest climate change regulations, as he seeks to boost fossil fuels.

item.dc:creator: By Alex Guillén

item.title: EPA repeals landmark finding that climate pollution is harmful
item.description: The move discards a scientific determination that empowered the government to limit climate pollution.

media:content.media:title: EPA Administrator Lee Zeldin testifies last May before a subcommittee of the House Energy and Commerce Committee.

item.dc:creator: By Jean Chemnick

item.title: Schumer dials up oversight pressure on Trump’s Venezuela oil fund
item.description: The Senate minority leader is introducing a bill to direct a GAO investigation of the Trump administration’s handling of Venezuelan oil proceeds.

media:content.media:title: Senate Minority Leader Chuck Schumer has criticized the Trump administration's unilateral moves in Venezuela.

item.dc:creator: By James Bikales

item.title: Trump administration moves closer to opening Venezuela to more US oil producers
item.description: The Treasury license allows companies to rehabilitate their existing oil equipment in Venezuela, much of which have fallen into disrepair.

media:content.media:title: People react to the news of the capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro after U.S. military actions in Venezuela in Doral, Florida, on Jan. 3, 2026.

item.dc:creator: By James Bikales

item.title: Trump EPA to take its biggest swing yet against climate change rules
item.description: With its plans to revoke the endangerment finding, the administration is gambling that the Supreme Court will allow it to completely avoid regulating the nation’s top greenhouse gas sources.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump has long proclaimed climate change to be a "hoax," and now his administration is preparing to revoke the longstanding scientific finding that underpins central climate regulations.

item.dc:creator: By Alex Guillén

item.title: Democrats gain an edge as poll show doubts on Trump energy strategy
item.description: Energy affordability is expected to play a role in the midterm elections this year.

media:content.media:credit: Illustration by Anna Wiederkehr/POLITICO (source images via Getty)
media:content.media:title: TPP-Energy Lede Image

item.dc:creator: By Zack Colman

item.title: White House eyes data center agreements amid energy price spikes
item.description: A draft pact, obtained by POLITICO, seeks to help ensure data centers do not raise household electricity prices, strain water resources or undermine grid reliability.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump holds an image showing the size of Meta's new data center during a Cabinet meeting on Aug. 26, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Sophia Cai, Jason Plautz and James Bikales
item.dc:contributor: By Sophia Cai, Jason Plautz and James Bikales

item.title: Energy secretary plans visit to Venezuela — but says Trump isn’t focused on its oil riches
item.description: Energy Secretary Chris Wright is scheduled to be the highest-level Trump administration official to set foot in Venezuela since Nicolás Maduro’s capture.

media:content.media:title: Energy Secretary Chris Wright speaks during a meeting with President Donald Trump and oil executives in the East Room of the White House, Jan. 9, 2026, in Washington.

item.dc:creator: By James Bikales

item.title: Trump cut science funding. Small businesses are paying the price.
item.description: Some federal contractors are feeling the squeeze after the president slashed support for climate programs and other research efforts.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump looks up as he signs executive orders last week at the White House.

item.dc:creator: By Chelsea Harvey

item.title: A startup falsely blamed for triggering floods pitches cloud seeding to lawmakers
item.description: Rainmaker Technology is spending hundreds of thousands of dollars on lobbying and gold-framed Metro ads in a play for national attention.

media:content.media:title: Rainmaker Technology CEO Augustus Doricko stands beside one of the startup's cloud-seeding drones outside Kamas, Utah, on Dec. 18, 2025.

item.dc:creator: By Corbin Hiar

item.title: The West’s water war arrives in Washington
item.description: The Trump administration’s hands-off approach to the fight over the Colorado River has left states careening towards a crisis — and it's not clear that Interior Secretary Doug Burgum can turn them around.

media:content.media:title: Interior Secretary Doug Burgum has summoned the governors of the seven states that are battling over the Colorado River for a Friday afternoon meeting.

item.dc:creator: By Annie Snider

item.title: Treasury opens Venezuelan crude oil trading up to more companies
item.description: The move will allow additional firms to join in the US-controlled effort to sell Venezuela’s oil.

media:content.media:title: Oil tankers are docked at the Cardon refinery in Punta Cardon, Venezuela, in January.

item.dc:creator: By James Bikales

item.title: So long, Paris: US officially leaves landmark climate pact
item.description: President Donald Trump has formally removed the U.S. from the historic agreement that aims to limit global warming.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump has called the Paris Agreement a "rip off."

item.dc:creator: By Sara Schonhardt

item.title: Winter storm tests US electric grid as outages spread
item.description: The extreme weather knocked out power across the South — and cold temperature will strain the power network for a week.

media:content.media:title: Fallen branches and trees lay across roadways and utility lines during a winter storm in Nashville, Tennessee, on Jan. 25, 2026.

item.dc:creator: By Zack Colman

item.title: Thousands of flights canceled as major winter storm moves across the US
item.description: About 140 million people, or more than 40% of the U.S. population, are under a winter storm warning from New Mexico to New England.

media:content.media:title: A flight status screen shows canceled flights to the Dallas-Fort Worth, Texas, area from the Salt Lake City International Airport amid a winter storm Saturday, Jan. 24, 2026, in Salt Lake City. (AP Photo/Sydney Schaefer)

item.dc:creator: By Associated Press

item.title: Trump administration weighs naval blockade to halt Cuban oil imports
item.description: “Energy is the chokehold to kill” the Cuban regime, said a person familiar with the discussions.

media:content.media:title: A person watches the oil tanker Ocean Mariner, Monrovia, arrive to the bay in Havana, Cuba, Jan. 9, 2026.

item.dc:creator: By Ben Lefebvre and Eric Bazail-Eimil
item.dc:contributor: By Ben Lefebvre and Eric Bazail-Eimil

item.title: EPA pokes Musk over using unpermitted turbines for AI
item.description: A new rule weighs in on the use of turbines at data centers like xAI’s Memphis-area facilities.

media:content.media:title: Elon Musk's artificial intelligence company, xAI, is under scrutiny for using dozens of large turbines.

item.dc:creator: By Ariel Wittenberg

item.title: Trump suffers major losses in his war on offshore wind
item.description: The administration’s arguments that offshore wind farms present a national security risk failed to convince judges in three separate courts.

media:content.media:title: A wind turbine near Block Island, Rhode Island.

item.dc:creator: By Kelsey Tamborrino, Josh Siegel, Lesley Clark and Niina H. Farah
item.dc:contributor: By Kelsey Tamborrino, Josh Siegel, Lesley Clark and Niina H. Farah

item.title: Trump launches bid to tame electricity prices in the Northeast
item.description: The White House joins governors in a move to boost electricity generation in one of the country’s most expensive markets.

media:content.media:title: image_asset_84553.jpg

item.dc:creator: By Zack Colman and Josh Siegel
item.dc:contributor: By Zack Colman and Josh Siegel

item.title: US oil producers pledge to help stabilize Iran if regime falls
item.description: American Petroleum Institute President Mike Sommers indicated the industry is more open to helping in Iran than it has been with Venezuela.

media:content.media:title: Mike Sommers, president of the American Petroleum Institute, during an event at the White House in June.

item.dc:creator: By James Bikales

item.title: Judge reverses Trump order halting Revolution Wind
item.description: Suspending the lease for the Orsted project off Connecticut and Rhode Island was "unreasonable," the federal judge ruled Monday.

media:content.media:title: Wind turbine bases, generators and blades are positioned at a staging area for offshore wind components.

item.dc:creator: By Benjamin Storrow

item.title: Arizona governor reverses support for data center tax breaks
item.description: Democrat Katie Hobbs had previously backed the incentives as a lawmaker, but on Monday said the industry needs to do more to support the state.

media:content.media:title: Arizona Gov. Katie Hobbs is calling for repealing state tax incentives for data centers and charging them based on their use of Colorado River water.

item.dc:creator: By Annie Snider

item.title: Trump ‘inclined’ to keep ExxonMobil out of Venezuela after CEO response at White House meeting
item.description: “I didn’t like Exxon’s response,” Trump told reporters on Air Force One on Sunday. “They’re playing too cute.”

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump speaks with Darren Woods, left, chief executive officer and chair of ExxonMobil, while Maryann Mannen, chair, president and CEO of Marathon Petroleum, right, and Matt Sheehy, president and CEO of Tallgrass Energy, far right, look on during a meeting with oil executives in the East Room of the White House, Friday, Jan. 9, 2026, in Washington. (AP Photo/Alex Brandon)

item.dc:creator: By Associated Press

item.title: ‘Uninvestable’: Trump pitch to oil execs yields no promises
item.description: The CEOs heaped praise on the president’s actions in Venezuela but made no firm commitments to put money into restoring the country’s oil production.

media:content.media:title: President Donald Trump points to a reporter for a question during a meeting with oil executives in the East Room of the White House on Jan. 9.

item.dc:creator: By James Bikales

item.title: Trump says oil companies pledge to spend $100B in Venezuela
item.description: The White House is scrambling to expand a Friday meeting with oil executives because of skepticism from the top oil majors.

media:content.media:title: An abandoned oil pumpjack stands in Cabimas, Venezuela, on Wednesday.

item.dc:creator: By James Bikales
